definition: to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
Washington (name)/George Washington (1732-1799), first US president/Washington, US State/Washington, D.C. (US federal capital)
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Manhattan island/Manhattan borough of New York City
Everton (town in northwest England)/Everton soccer team
to find a place for/to help settle down/to arrange for/undisturbed/peaceful

sentences.english: Beaverton's % Mayor Doyle wants refugee and immigrant leaders to participate in the town's decision-making.
sentences.chinese: 比弗顿市长道尔希望难民和移民领袖参与本市的决策。

sentences.english: Liverpool, meanwhile, are monitoring the young Preston North End midfielder Adam Barton.
sentences.chinese: 利物浦对普瑞斯顿的中场巴顿密切关注中。

sentences.english: What Chastain was wearing was, in fact, a prototype for the Nike Inner Actives range of sports underwear.
sentences.chinese: 其实，查斯顿穿的是耐克运动内衣系列的样品。

sentences.english: Weston now demanded all profits from these sales go entirely to the investors.
sentences.chinese: 威斯顿如今却要求所有销售的利润均归投资者。

sentences.english: When Gaston arose in the morning, his wife had already departed.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上加斯顿起床的时候，他的妻子已经离开了。
让我们弌起吃顿午餐吧。

sentences.english: The most notable legal treatise in the century is Littleton's Tenures .
sentences.chinese: 该世纪最著名的法学著作是利特力顿的《土地使用》。

sentences.english: Mr. Rolston was born in the state of Virginia in 1932.
sentences.chinese: 罗尔斯顿先生1932年出生在弗吉尼亚。

sentences.english: Nobody , neither hareton nor zillah , is to know.
sentences.chinese: 没有人知道，哈里顿或拉也不知道。

sentences.english: What's the fastest way to Belton Street?
sentences.chinese: 到贝尔顿小巷走哪条路最快？

sentences.english: In March, Hareton had had an accident and been confined to the farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 三月份，哈里顿发生了一起事故，并被囚禁在了农舍。

sentences.english: I guessed that the Stapletons were the pair.
sentences.chinese: 我揣测到斯台普顿兄妹就是要找的那对。

sentences.english: Now we have Ashton Kutcher speaking out, citing the Mayan Calendar.
sentences.chinese: 如今我们有艾什顿库奇站进去发言，援用玛雅历法。

sentences.english: " She paused for a" I am he that flower spirit.
sentences.chinese: 她顿了一顿“我便是那花灵。”

sentences.english: With Isabella dying, Edgar travels to London to pick up Linton.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎贝拉死后，埃德加去伦敦接回了小林顿。

sentences.english: In the end, we find out that Holden is telling his story from the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我们发现这个故事是霍尔顿在医院讲的。

definition: to suffer/to endure/to pull through (hard times)/to delay/to stall/to play for time/to dawdle
foreign (non-Chinese)/barbarian/classifier for occurrences (of an event, action or speech utterance)/classifier for iterations: times, -fold (as in twofold etc)/classifier for situations: kind, sort
to be finished/to be done for/ruined/gone to the dogs/oh no
to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
